Use INLA as engine

Source: R/engine_inla.R
engine_inla.Rd

References https://becarioprecario.bitbucket.io/inla-gitbook/ch-spatial.html#ref-Simpsonetal:2016

engine_inla(
  x,
  optional_mesh = NULL,
  optional_projstk = NULL,
  max.edge = c(1, 5),
  offset = c(1, 1),
  cutoff = 1,
  proj_stepsize = NULL,
  timeout = NULL,
  barrier = FALSE,
  ...
)

Arguments

x

distribution() (i.e. BiodiversityDistribution) object.
optional_mesh

A directly supplied INLA mesh (Default: NULL)
optional_projstk

A directly supplied projection stack. Useful if projection stack is identical for multiple species (Default: NULL)
max.edge

The largest allowed triangle edge length, must be in the same scale units as the coordinates
offset

interpreted as a numeric factor relative to the approximate data diameter;
cutoff

The minimum allowed distance between points on the mesh
proj_stepsize

The stepsize in coordinate units between cells of the projection grid (Default: NULL)
timeout

Specify a timeout for INLA models in sec. Afterwards it passed.
barrier

Should a barrier model be added to the model?
...

Other variables
nonconvex.bdry

Create a non-convex boundary hulls instead (Default: FALSE) TBD
nonconvex.convex

Non-convex minimal extension radius for convex curvature TBD
nonconvex.concave

Non-convex minimal extension radius for concave curvature TBD
nonconvex.res

Computation resolution for nonconvex.hulls TBD
